narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: You learn a LOT of Chinese!

My overall knowledge of Chinese language and culture has improved significantly. I have really been able to receive clear feedback in my speaking abilities, and the comments I have received on my writing have been nothing but helpful. It was these skills that certainly developed from taking this course.
Advanced Chinese reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills
I learned Chinese at a more formal level.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Strengths: the format is AMAZING! It really drills in you the important grammar, vocab, sentence structures, etc. It has a clear focus, and all the homework, classwork, assignments, are designed to lead you toward a particular goal. Some might think it's repetitive, but I think that's the purpose. When the oral homework are similar questions to the classroom practice questions, it naturally forces you to adopt the new vocab and grammar and sentence structures, and make them yours!

Absolutely incredible teaching as usual in the Chinese department. Even on zoom, their creativity and hard work was astounding. Would highly recommend continuing through the Chinese sequence. No weaknesses.

The strength of the course was that it truly challenged all aspects of the language - speaking, reading, writing. The assessments were very well-balanced and truly helped me improve as a student in a more well-rounded manner.

It would be great to have more speaking time in class. Sometimes the material if quantity over quality and I would forget things from prior chapters because there is a lot of material and it doesn't always circle back. It would be great if we were told to focus on more particular lesson points and if lessons were more cumulative.  The class was very well organized and good study guides and materials were provided.
I thought the class was extremely interesting, but it was hard to stay engaged online.
It is hard to do online, but the department does a very good job and are accommodating of the adjustment to online.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Virtual engagement was good.
Very well adapted to virtual learning.

The following course was very successful during the pandemic. The canvas page of the course was always very clear and  the assignments were uploaded well ahead of time. The small class setting was also very well-supported over zoom.
I wish the instructor cold-called students more. It is harder to volunteer to speak up in a virtual class, and so the people most comfortable stepping in would speak the most.
I think more out reach could help, but again the department did a good job to transition it to online.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely! Get ready to learn a lot of Chinese. Looking back, you will see how much you improved, and be satisfied.
Yes, if you want to continue with Chinese, 154 is 100% worth doing.

Yes, definitely. The small class size and the rigor of the course truly helped me improve my Chinese-speaking abilities. The accessibility for all the resources in the course also helped me grow as a student. I highly recommend the following course.
Yes, this is a good course in the Chinese learning track
Yes I would it was extremely helpful for improving my Chinese
Yes
yes
